revised_title: Endothelin and ATP Release in Hypoxic and Normoxic Rat Aortic Endothelial Cells
tldr: This study investigates the release of endothelin and ATP from rat aortic endothelial cells under normoxic and hypoxic conditions. The results show that during high flow, endothelial cells from hypoxic rats release less ATP and more endothelin compared to normoxic rats. This suggests that under low oxygen conditions, a balance between ATP and endothelin release may regulate the response of vessels to shear stress.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Vascular Biology
